![Node.js CI](https://github.com/libsugar/sugar.js/workflows/Node.js%20CI/badge.svg)

![JS](https://img.shields.io/badge/JS-232323?logo=javascript)
[![TS](https://img.shields.io/badge/TS-fcfcfc?logo=typescript)](https://www.typescriptlang.org/)
[![babel](https://img.shields.io/badge/babel-232323?logo=babel)](https://babeljs.io/)

[![jest](https://img.shields.io/badge/jest-C21325?logo=jest)](https://jestjs.io/)
[![jsDelivr](https://img.shields.io/badge/jsDelivr-fec82f?logo=jsDelivr&logoColor=E84D3D)](https://www.jsdelivr.com/)


Like syntactic sugar, but is library

[Documentation](https://libsugar.github.io/sugar.js/)

> The main goal of the libsugar project is to eliminate the differences in the standard library between different languages and the secondary goal is to provide many sweet tools

![](./libsuga.socialr.js.png)

## Install

npm

```sh
npm i libsugar
```

yarn

```sh
yarn add libsugar
```

pnpm

```sh
pnpm i libsugar
```

cnpm

```sh
cnpm i libsugar
```

import

```ts
import {} from 'libsugar'
```

require

```ts
const {} = require('libsugar')
```

umd

```html
<script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/libsugar/dist/sugar.js"></script>
```

esm

```html
<script type="module" src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/libsugar/dist/sugar.mjs"></script>
```
